ResourceHeader.Description: MUNIN Nanosatellite MEDUSA Ion Counts, Fluxes, and Particle Distributions, 1 eV to 12 keV. The MUNIN_M1_MDSE Data Product CDF Files have been written by using Instrument Data File Set, IDFS, Parent Files as input for the CDF Production Effort. IDFS are Sets of Files written in a prescribed Format that contain Data, Timing Data, and Metadata.

Parameter.Name: Ion Telemetry Data
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH

Structure.Description: MEDUSA allows for simultaneous Measurements of both Electrons and Ions without Mass Resolution. Particles are measured with an Angular Resolution of 22.5° in the Aperture Plane, which is tilted 3° to the Spacecraft Spin Plane, by using 16 Anodes or "Sectors". For Electrons, 16 Energy Sweeps/s are performed, and for Ions, 8 Sweeps/s. Each Energy Sweep consists of 32 Discrete Energy Steps with descending Logarithmic Level. Of the 32 Steps, one Step is used for resetting the Deflection Voltage to its Maximum Value. The Particle Data are contained in Arrays with Dimensions of 16 by 32 accomodating the 16 Energy Sectors and 32 Energy Steps. The Spin Plane Element to Sector Mapping for the MEDUSA Ion Energy Analyzer are as follows: Element 1: Sector 0, 56.25°, Element 2: Sector 1, 33.75°, Element 3: Sector 2, 78.75°, Element 4: Sector 3, 11.25°, Element 5: Sector 4, 101.25°, Element 6: Sector 5, -11.25°, Element 7: Sector 6, 123.75°, Element 8: Sector 7, -33.75°, Element 9: Sector 8, 146.25°, Element 10: Sector 9, -56.25°, Element 11: Sector 10, 168.75°, Element 12: Sector 11, -78.75°, Element 13: Sector 12, -168.75°, Element 14: Sector 13, -101.25°, Element 15: Sector 14, -146.25°, Element 16: Sector 15, -123.75°.

Parameter.Name: Ion Distribution Function by Sensor at Sample Scans, cm Scale
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Caveats: Average Type: standard This parameter is virtual. It is calculated by calling the function ALTERNATE_VIEW with the following input parameters: MEDUSA_Ion_11_DF_sec_3_per_cm_6.

Structure.Description: MEDUSA allows for simultaneous Measurements of both Electrons and Ions without Mass Resolution. Particles are measured with an Angular Resolution of 22.5° in the Aperture Plane, which is tilted 3° to the Spacecraft Spin Plane, by using 16 Anodes or "Sectors". For Electrons, 16 Energy Sweeps/s are performed, and for Ions, 8 Sweeps/s. Each Energy Sweep consists of 32 Discrete Energy Steps with descending Logarithmic Level. Of the 32 Steps, one Step is used for resetting the Deflection Voltage to its Maximum Value. The Particle Data are contained in Arrays with Dimensions of 16 by 32 accomodating the 16 Energy Sectors and 32 Energy Steps. The Spin Plane Element to Sector Mapping for the MEDUSA Ion Energy Analyzer are as follows: Element 1: Sector 0, 56.25°, Element 2: Sector 1, 33.75°, Element 3: Sector 2, 78.75°, Element 4: Sector 3, 11.25°, Element 5: Sector 4, 101.25°, Element 6: Sector 5, -11.25°, Element 7: Sector 6, 123.75°, Element 8: Sector 7, -33.75°, Element 9: Sector 8, 146.25°, Element 10: Sector 9, -56.25°, Element 11: Sector 10, 168.75°, Element 12: Sector 11, -78.75°, Element 13: Sector 12, -168.75°, Element 14: Sector 13, -101.25°, Element 15: Sector 14, -146.25°, Element 16: Sector 15, -123.75°.
